profile.shortBio: Guy Leonard works with comparative genomics, phylogenomics and genome assembly with an interest in the evolutionary relationships of eukaryotes. Lead Developer and Co-Director of the Workshop on Genomics.

Marina Marcet-Houben at Barcelona Supercomputing Center. Phylogenomics supports microsporidia as the earliest diverging clade of sequenced fungi. Skills in Next Generation Sequencing, Genomics, and Bioinformatics.

Daniel McDonald holds a Ph.D. in Computer Science from UC Boulder. He specializes as a developer using popular microbiome software and works on reproducible, interactive, scalable and extensible microbiome data science using QIIME 2.

Claudia Bank leads the Theoretical Ecology and Evolution group at SIB. Her overarching goal is to quantify the relative roles of ecological and evolutionary forces for the buildup and maintenance of diversity.
profile.source: SIB website, Evolution and Genomics website

profile.shortBio: Julian Catchen developed Stacks, an analysis tool set for population genomics. Stacks was developed to work with restriction enzyme-based data such as RAD-seq, for building genetic maps and conducting population genomics analyses.

professional.department: Statistics and Evolution, Ecology and Organismal Biology

profile.shortBio: Dag Ahrén studies genetic and genomic mechanisms related to fungal host interactions using genomics and transcriptomics approaches coupled with bioinformatics analyses, particularly focused on nematode-trapping fungi.

professional.title: Associate Professor
professional.department: Department of Biology, Computational and RNA Biology

profile.shortBio: Anders Albrechtsen is an Associate Professor at the Bioinformatics Centre, University of Copenhagen. His group develops statistical and computational methods for analysis of genomic data including multi-loci association studies and detecting natural selection.

professional.title: Guest Researcher
professional.affiliation: University of Oslo / University of Basel
professional.department: CEES - Centre for Ecological and Evolutionary Synthesis

profile.shortBio: Julia M.I. Barth studies genomic differentiation and demographic histories of Atlantic and Indo-Pacific yellowfin tuna populations. She is involved in various population genomic projects including the Aqua Genome project, studying connectivity, gene flow, and adaptation in marine fish species.
profile.source: University of Oslo CEES / Evolution and Genomics website

profile.shortBio: Robert Beiko is a Professor in the Faculty of Computer Science at Dalhousie University. His research focuses on bioinformatics, comparative genomics and phylogenetics, machine learning, visualization of biological data, and the human microbiome.

Daniel Berner is a population genomics researcher at University of Basel studying adaptive divergence in stickleback fish, speciation, and the genetic basis of adaptation and range expansion in butterflies.

Rayan Chikhi leads a computational team researching algorithms for big biological data at Institut Pasteur. The group creates and implements algorithms and data structures into software tools for genomics and metagenomics, including methods for improving bacterial genome assemblies with long reads.
Bill Cresko studies evolutionary genomics using threespine stickleback fish as a model system. Co-organizer of the Workshop on Population and Speciation Genomics.

professional.title: Professor
additionalRoles: Director, Center for Bioinformatics and Computational Biology, UMIACS
Director, Master of Science Program in Bioinformatics and Computational Biology

profile.shortBio: Michael Cummings is a Professor of Biology at the University of Maryland. His research involves bioinformatics and computational biology with a particular focus on data analysis that spans a broad range of biomedical problems using machine learning, statistical and other methods.
profile.source: University of Maryland Department of Biology

profile.shortBio: Petr Danacek is a Senior Bioinformatician at the Wellcome Sanger Institute with a background in computer science and PhD in biophysics. He is one of the lead developers of BCFtools/SAMtools/HTSlib and was involved in large-scale sequencing projects such as 1000 Genomes Project, UK10k, or Deciphering Developmental Disorders.

professional.title: Dr
professional.department: School of Biological and Behavioural Sciences

profile.shortBio: Dr Mario Dos Reis Barros teaches Human Genetics and Genomics at the Joint Programme with Nanchang University. His research focuses on molecular evolution, phylogenetics, and using genomic data to understand evolutionary processes and timing.
Johannes Dröge specializes in algorithmic bioinformatics with a focus on environmental research and metagenomics using next-generation sequencing data.

professional.title: Professor of Computational Biology
professional.department: School of Biological Sciences & School of Computer Science

profile.shortBio: Alexei Drummond is co-inventor of BEAST and BEAST 2 software packages and co-founder of the Centre for Computational Evolution at University of Auckland. He has >20 years of Java programming experience and research expertise in computational biology for understanding evolutionary biology and population genetics.
profile.source: Personal website and University of Auckland

profile.shortBio: Milos Duchoslav is a Postdoc in the Plant ecological genomics group at Charles University in Prague. His specialties include plant molecular biology, bioinformatics, proteomics, and photosystem II research.

A/Prof Rachael Dudaniec examines how environmental conditions affect genetic connectivity and evolutionary processes within species. She links this information with data on pathogen impacts and diversity to understand how species persist and evolve across diverse landscapes.

Gytis Dudas is a scientist at Vilnius University's Life Sciences Center in Lithuania who works on viruses. His interests broadly cover the evolution and ecology of RNA viruses from the most closely related lineages in an outbreak setting to radical changes viruses undergo over evolutionary time.

professional.title: Professor
professional.department: Department of Genetics / Wellcome Sanger Institute

profile.shortBio: Richard Durbin is a computational biologist and one of the founders of the field of computational genomics. Key contributor to the Human Genome Project.
Evan Eichler is a leader in primate genome evolution and structural variation. Howard Hughes Medical Institute Investigator.

professional.title: Senior Lecturer
professional.department: School of Biological and Behavioural Sciences

profile.shortBio: Matteo Fumagalli moved to Imperial College London in 2016 and then became Lecturer in Quantitative Evolution at Silwood Park in 2017. He joined Queen Mary University of London as Senior Lecturer in Genetics in 2021. His research focuses on population genetics and bioinformatics.
profile.source: Queen Mary University of London, Google Scholar

profile.shortBio: Toni Gabaldón is a Senior Group Leader at the Institut de Recerca Biomèdica in Barcelona, specializing in comparative genomics, phylogenomics, and fungal evolution.

professional.title: Assistant Professor
professional.affiliation: University of Tennessee Health Science Center
professional.department: Department of Genetics, Genomics and Informatics

profile.shortBio: Erik Garrison develops computational methods for pangenomics and variation graphs. Creator of FreeBayes and other genomics tools.

Kirk is a statistical geneticist by training with experience in bioinformatics and computational biology working with various levels of omics data for inferring the architecture of genotype-phenotype maps for complex traits and diseases.

professional.title: Professor
professional.department: Department of Medical Biochemistry and Microbiology
professional.additionalRole: Nathaniel Robert Street Professor, Umeå Plant Science Centre

profile.shortBio: Manfred Grabherr is Head of NGS and bioinformatics at State Laboratory Schleswig-Holstein, Germany. Previously at Uppsala University, Sweden & IPI, Polish Academy of Sciences, Poland. Patric Jern Uppsala University. His research includes genome assembly and evolutionary genomics.

professional.title: Associate Professor of Medicine and Genetics
professional.department: McDonnell Genome Institute & School of Medicine
professional.additionalRole: Assistant Director of the McDonnell Genome Institute

profile.shortBio: Dr. Griffith has more than 15 years of experience in the fields of genomics, bioinformatics, data mining, and cancer research. His research is focused on the development of personalized medicine strategies for cancer using genomic technologies.
Roderic Guigo is a computational biologist working in systems genetics and genomics.

professional.title: Associate Professor
additionalAffiliations: Departments of Ecology and Evolutionary Biology

profile.shortBio: Ryan Gutenkunst joined the faculty in Molecular and Cellular Biology at the University of Arizona in Fall 2010. His research program integrates population genomics and systems biology to incorporate molecular mechanisms into evolutionary genetics.
profile.source: University of Arizona, Zuckerman College of Public Health

professional.title: Principal Computational Scientist
professional.affiliation: Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard

profile.shortBio: Brian Haas is a Principal Computational Scientist at Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard. He is a Bioinformatics software developer and data analyst with a focus on leveraging transcriptomics for studies in genomics and cancer.

professional.title: Distinguished Professor
professional.department: Department of Biology and Computer Science

profile.shortBio: Matthew Hahn is a Distinguished Professor studying molecular evolution and population genetics. Author of 'Molecular Population Genetics' textbook.

professional.title: Associate Professor
professional.department: Edison Family Center for Genome Sciences & Systems Biology

profile.shortBio: Scott Handley is the founder and director of the Workshop on Genomics and co-founder of workshops on Population & Speciation Genomics and Phylogenomics. His research focuses on the human virome and microbiome interactions.

professional.title: Associate Professor
professional.department: Department of Ecology, Evolution, and Organismal Biology

profile.shortBio: Tracy Heath's research program focuses on developing and applying computational methods for understanding evolutionary processes in a phylogenetic context. Her primary approach to developing phylogenetic tools is to apply new statistical models as priors using Bayesian inference methods.

professional.title: Assistant Professor
professional.department: Department of Molecular and Cell Biology
professional.additionalRole: CLAS Molecular and Cell Biology Website

profile.shortBio: Sarah Hird's research focuses on host-microbiome evolution, gut microbiota, bioinformatics, microbial ecology, ornithology, and phylogeography. She is Assistant Professor at the Department of Molecular and Cell Biology at University of Connecticut.

PD Dr. Katharina Hoff is a Privatdozentin at the Institut für Mathematik und Informatik, Universität Greifswald. Her research focuses on bioinformatics, particularly genome annotation and structural gene prediction.

professional.title: Senior Scientist
professional.additionalRole: Professor of Biology at the University of East Anglia

profile.shortBio: Sophien Kamoun is a Tunisian biologist and senior scientist at The Sainsbury Laboratory. The Kamoun lab studies the interactions between plants and filamentous pathogens, notably the potato famine organism Phytophthora infestans and the rice and wheat blast fungus Magnaporthe oryzae.

professional.title: PhD Student (former)
professional.department: Institute of Evolutionary Biology, Field of Bioinformatics

profile.shortBio: Michal Karlicki worked on MetaPlastHunter: An efficient pipeline for classifying chloroplast reads from metagenomic data. His research focused on searching for Plastid Genomes in the Metagenomic Data.
profile.source: University of Warsaw IBE, ResearchGate, GitHub

professional.title: Associate Professor
professional.department: Institute of Evolutionary Biology, Faculty of Biology

profile.shortBio: Dr hab. Anna Karnkowska's research focuses on the diversity, evolution and ecology of eukaryotic microorganisms (aka protists). The lab is part of the Institute of Evolutionary Biology at Faculty of Biology at University of Warsaw and the Diversity of Eukaryotic Microorganisms Consortium (DEMON).
profile.source: University of Warsaw IBE, Personal Lab Website

profile.shortBio: Andrew Kern is an academic expert in population genetics, evolutionary biology, machine learning, computational biology, and genomics. His research combines modern machine learning methods with classical probabilistic approaches and large-scale simulation to gain insight into evolutionary processes.
profile.source: University of Oregon Institute of Ecology and Evolution

professional.title: Professor & Founding Director
professional.department: Departments of Pediatrics, Bioengineering, Computer Science & Engineering, and Halıcıoğlu Data Science Institute
professional.additionalRole: Founding Director of the Center for Microbiome Innovation

profile.shortBio: Rob Knight is the founding Director of the Center for Microbiome Innovation and Professor of Pediatrics, Shu Chien-Gene Lay Department of Bioengineering, Computer Science & Engineering and Halıcıoğlu Data Science Institute at UC San Diego. He is the Wolfe Family Endowed Chair.

Eline Lorenzen is a Professor at the GLOBE Institute, University of Copenhagen, specializing in conservation genomics and ancient DNA research to understand biodiversity patterns and inform conservation efforts.

professional.title: Professor of Bioinformatics
professional.department: MRC Weatherall Institute of Molecular Medicine

profile.shortBio: Gerton Lunter is a Professor of Bioinformatics at Oxford University's MRC Weatherall Institute. His research focuses on developing computational and statistical methods for analyzing genomic data and understanding genome evolution.

professional.title: Research Group Leader
professional.affiliation: Max Planck Institute for Evolutionary Anthropology

profile.shortBio: Fabrizio Mafessoni leads a research group at the Max Planck Institute for Evolutionary Anthropology, focusing on computational approaches to understand human evolution through ancient DNA and population genetics.

professional.title: Guest
professional.department: Department of Cellular, Computational and Integrative Biology - CIBIO

profile.shortBio: Paolo Manghi is a computational biologist at University of Trento's CIBIO department, specializing in microbiome research and metagenomic analysis of microbial communities.
Simon Martin studies evolutionary genomics and speciation at the University of Cambridge, with a focus on understanding how natural selection shapes genetic diversity in butterfly populations.

professional.title: Adjunct Professor
professional.affiliation: Natural History Museum, University of Oslo

profile.shortBio: Michael Matschiner is an Adjunct Professor at the Natural History Museum, University of Oslo, specializing in phylogenomics and molecular dating to understand the evolutionary history of fishes and other organisms.

professional.title: Professor / Head of Research Group
professional.department: Department of Computational Biology for Infection Research

profile.shortBio: Alice McHardy is a Professor and Head of the Department of Computational Biology for Infection Research at the Helmholtz Centre. She develops computational methods for analyzing microbial communities and understanding infection processes.

Sheldon McKay is a bioinformatics scientist specializing in genome sequencing and annotation. He develops functional genomics tools to apply high-throughput techniques for understanding gene function and interactions.

Aoife McLysaght is a Professor of Genetics at Trinity College Dublin. Her research focuses on molecular evolution, comparative genomics, and understanding how genomes evolve through gene duplication and other mechanisms.
Paul McMurdie is the developer of phyloseq, an R package for reproducible interactive analysis and graphics of microbiome census data. He specializes in statistical methods for microbiome analysis.

Joana Meier leads a research group at the Wellcome Sanger Institute studying speciation genomics. She teaches at workshops including the Workshop on Population and Speciation Genomics, focusing on understanding genomic mechanisms of speciation.

professional.title: Computational Biologist
professional.department: Faculty of Mathematics, Informatics and Natural Sciences

profile.shortBio: Britta Meyer is a computational biologist at University of Hamburg specializing in evolutionary immunogenomics. She is an instructor for the Workshop on Population and Speciation Genomics.

Erin Molloy is an Assistant Professor in Computer Science at University of Maryland. Her research focuses on developing algorithms for phylogenetic tree estimation and computational methods for evolutionary biology.

Dr Jordi Paps Montserrat studies major evolutionary transitions using molecular and genomic approaches. His lab aims to unravel the molecular and genomic changes underlying evolutionary shifts like the origins of animals or plants.

Leonie Moyle is a Professor of Biology at Indiana University studying the genetics of speciation and reproductive isolation, particularly in wild tomato species. Her research focuses on understanding how new species evolve.

professional.title: Professor
professional.department: Department of Statistics and Wellcome Centre for Human Genetics

profile.shortBio: Simon Myers is a Professor at Oxford University developing statistical and computational methods to analyze genetic variation. His research focuses on understanding recombination, mutation, and selection in shaping genetic diversity.

professional.title: Professor
professional.department: Department of Integrative Biology and Department of Statistics

profile.shortBio: Rasmus Nielsen is a Professor at UC Berkeley in both Integrative Biology and Statistics. His research focuses on developing statistical methods for making inferences about evolution, molecular evolution, and population genetics.

professional.title: Professor of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology
professional.department: Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology

profile.shortBio: Anton Nekrutenko is a Professor at Penn State and co-founder of the Galaxy platform for analysis of biological data. He developed Galaxy to make computational biology accessible to researchers without programming expertise.

Patrik Nosil is Director of Research at CEFE, CNRS studying evolution, ecology, and genetics. His research focuses on understanding the genomic basis of speciation and how ecological adaptation drives evolutionary divergence.
Sergey Nurk is a Staff Scientist at NIH working on genome assembly algorithms. He is a key member of the Telomere-to-Telomere (T2T) Consortium that produced the first complete human genome assembly.

Huw Ogilvie is the lead author of StarBEAST2, a widely used method for joint inference of species and gene trees. He develops computational methods for phylogenetic inference and helps coordinate development of PhyloNet software.

professional.title: Director of Research
professional.department: Centre for Anthropobiology and Genomics of Toulouse

profile.shortBio: Ludovic Orlando is a leading paleogeneticist and Director of Research at CNRS. He leads the Centre for Anthropobiology and Genomics of Toulouse, specializing in ancient DNA and the genomic history of domestication.
Josephine Paris is the Workshop Director for the Workshop on Genomics. She is a Marie Skłodowska-Curie Fellow at University of Oxford organizing intensive training opportunities in genomics.
Konrad Paszkiewicz heads the University of Exeter Sequencing Service and Wellcome Trust Biomedical Informatics Hub. He specializes in empowering biologists to interpret their genomic data.

professional.title: Professor
professional.department: Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Genetics

profile.shortBio: William Pearson is the developer of the FASTA algorithm for sequence similarity searching, one of the foundational tools in bioinformatics. He is a Professor at University of Virginia.
Katie Peichel studies the genetics of adaptation in stickleback fish, focusing on understanding the roles of pleiotropy and linkage in evolution. Her research examines how new species evolve.

professional.title: Visiting Researcher
professional.department: Department of Organismal Biology: Systematic Biology

profile.shortBio: Valentina Peona is a visiting researcher at Uppsala University studying transposable elements and their role in genome evolution, particularly in bird genomes.
Martin Petr developed the admixr R package providing an easy interface to ADMIXTOOLS for population genetics analyses. He specializes in computational methods for studying human evolution.

professional.title: Project Manager
professional.department: Department of Immunology, Genetics and Pathology

profile.shortBio: Olga Vinnere Pettersson is Project Manager at the Department of Immunology, Genetics and Pathology and involved with Uppsala Genome Center, supporting genomics research infrastructure.

professional.title: Senior Research Leader
professional.department: Centre for Plant Biotechnology and Genomics

profile.shortBio: Lisa Pokorny is a Senior Research Leader at Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew. Her research focuses on phylogenetic reconstruction and understanding plant evolution through genomic approaches.
Chris Ponting is a Professor at the MRC Human Genetics Unit, University of Edinburgh. His research focuses on computational approaches to understand genome function and evolution.
Karin Rengefors is a Professor at Lund University studying phytoplankton ecology and evolution, with a focus on understanding harmful algal blooms and microbial diversity in aquatic systems.

professional.title: Head of Molecular Ecology and Biotechnology Unit

profile.shortBio: Naiara Rodriguez-Ezpeleta leads the Molecular Ecology and Biotechnology Unit at AZTI, integrating genomics, transcriptomics and bioinformatics approaches for marine environment research.
